title: Provision of gender-affirming care for trans and gender-diverse adults a systematic review of health and quality of life outcomes, values and preferences, and costs
summary: GAC = ↑ quality of life ↓ stigma ↑ mental health ↑ health service utilisation, no significant harms
description: Twenty-eight studies, including four randomized controlled trials and 24 longitudinal studies, evaluated health outcomes following gender-affirming care. Moderate to very low certainty evidence from these studies suggests gender-affirming care may improve quality of life, stigma, utilization of health services, and mental health. No studies identified significant negative outcomes or harms.
